name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
setup: Sit back on bench with dumbbells in each hand
Let arms hang straight down, palms facing forward
Shoulders back, chest up, core braced
steps: Curl dumbbells up, keeping elbows pinned in position
Supinate wrists (turn pinkies out) as you lift
Squeeze biceps at top of movement
Lower dumbbells under control to full stretch
mistakes: Not achieving full stretch at bottom
safety: If elbows or shoulders feel strained, reduce weight or adjust bench angle to 30°. Great for biceps stretch and peak contraction.

regressions: Bench at 60° (less stretch, easier on shoulders)
Alternating incline curls (one arm at a time)
progressions: Incline Zottman curls (supinate up, pronate down)

prescriptionHints.notes: Excellent biceps builder with emphasis on stretch and peak contraction. Start light to master the pattern.

joints.notes: Keep elbows stationary and avoid letting them drift forward. Full stretch at bottom, but don't hyperextend elbows.
